item.description:
An opportunity to volunteer with the Prison Book Program.

http://www.prisonbookprogram.org/

 

Tasks include selecting books for the Prison Program and reading letters to the inmates.

 

Address:

Basement of the United First Parish Church
1306 Hancock Street
Quincy, MA

PBP is in the basement of the United First Parish Church across the street from the Quincy Center T station and Quincy City Hall. Please use the basement door on Temple Street, towards the back of the Church, near the traffic light and across the street from the "Quincy Market" convenience store.

 

T Stop: Quincy Center T stop

 

Parking:

  • Street parking around the church is unrestricted after 6:00 PM but is often hard to find on weeknights. It is plentiful on the weekends.
  • Paid garage parking is available in the MBTA garage on Hancock Street or at the Presidents Place mall across the street from the church. Presidents Place parking is no longer free on Saturday

    The Boston Volunteers
    Big enough to Deliver, small enough to care
    Learn more: www.BostonVolunteer.org


    P.S. Learn more about your fellow Boston Volunteers.........http://www.facebook.com/BostonVolunteers

    P.P.S. Many Boston Volunteers are friending our friend, the popular Paulette.
    Who is Paulette: http://www.facebook.com/paulette.revere.7

group.name: Boston Volunteers. Big enough 2 deliver, small enough 2 care

item.name: Volunteer for the Prison Book Program
